entry.title: Kimi K2 vs Qwen-3 Coder: Testing Two AI Models on Coding Tasks
entry.summary: I tested Kimi K2 and Qwen-3 Coder on 13 Rust development tasks across a 38k-line codebase and 2 Frontend refactor tasks. The results reveal differences in code quality, instruction following, and development capabilities.

entry.title: Why Token Pricing for Dev Tools is Broken (And What We're Doing About It)
entry.summary: Why per-seat pricing is the closest we can get to fair, outcome-based pricing for developer tools.

entry.title: Forge Performance RCA: Root Cause Analysis of Quality Degradation on July 12, 2025
entry.summary: A detailed root cause analysis of the Forge AI coding assistant's quality degradation incident on July 12, 2025, including the impact of aggressive conversation compaction and steps taken for future prevention and stability improvements.

entry.title: Grok 4 Initial Impressions: Is xAI's New LLM the Most Intelligent AI Model Yet?
entry.summary: A deep dive into Grok 4's benchmarks, architecture, and community impressions. Is xAI's latest LLM a breakthrough towards AGI, and is it worth integrating into your AI development workflow?

entry.title: Claude 4 Opus vs Grok 4: Which Model Dominates Complex Coding Tasks?
entry.summary: I pitted Claude 4 Opus against Grok 4 in a series of challenging coding tasks. The results highlight trade-offs in speed, cost, accuracy, and frustration factors that every dev should know.

entry.title: Forge v0.98.0: Integrated Authentication and Developer Experience Improvements
entry.summary: Forge v0.98.0 release brings browser-based authentication, AI safety limits, and enhanced file operations for AI coding assistants. Streamline your terminal development workflow with improved reliability and developer experience.

entry.title: MCP 2025-06-18 Spec Update: AI Security, Structured Output, and User Elicitation for LLMs
entry.summary: Real talk about MCP Spec update (v2025-06-18), including important changes, security implications and what developers should actually care about.

entry.title: Simple Over Easy: Architectural Constraints for Maintainable AI-Generated Code
entry.summary: Discover how applying Rich Hickey's 'Simple Made Easy' principles can solve the 'AI 90/10 problem', leading to more maintainable and reviewable AI-generated code by constraining architectural choices.

entry.title: MCP Security Crisis: Uncovering Vulnerabilities and Attack Vectors - Part 1
entry.summary: A deep dive into critical security vulnerabilities found in Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementations, including tool description injection, authentication weaknesses, and supply chain risks, highlighting why these issues demand immediate attention in AI development.

entry.title: MCP Security Prevention: Practical Strategies for AI Development - Part 2
entry.summary: Dive into real-world MCP security vulnerabilities and discover actionable prevention strategies for AI development, focusing on prompt injection, cost-based attacks, and secure credential handling.

entry.title: When Google Sneezes, the Whole World Catches a Cold
entry.summary: Deep dive into the IAM failure that took down Google Cloud, cascaded into Cloudflare and Anthropic, and rippled across dozens of internet services.

entry.title: AI Code Agents: Indexed vs. Non-Indexed Performance for Real-Time Development
entry.summary: Explore a benchmark comparison of indexed vs. non-indexed AI coding agents using Apollo 11's guidance computer code. Uncover critical insights into speed, accuracy, and the hidden costs of synchronization in AI-assisted development.

entry.title: AI Agent Best Practices: 12 Lessons from AI Pair Programming for Developers
entry.summary: Discover field-tested best practices for productive AI-assisted development. Learn 12 crucial lessons from 6 months of daily AI pair programming, covering effective planning, prompt engineering, context management, and common pitfalls to avoid for maximizing developer efficiency.

entry.title: DeepSeek-R1-0528: A Detailed Review of its AI Coding Performance & Latency
entry.summary: A comprehensive review of DeepSeek-R1-0528's AI coding capabilities, architectural innovations, and significant latency challenges via OpenRouter API. Is this open-source LLM ready for your real-time development workflow?

entry.title: Claude Sonnet 4 vs Gemini 2.5 Pro Preview: AI Coding Assistant Comparison
entry.summary: An in-depth comparison of Claude Sonnet 4 and Gemini 2.5 Pro Preview for AI-assisted coding, evaluating their efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and critical instruction adherence in real-world development workflows.

entry.title: Claude 4 Initial Impressions: A Developer's Review of Anthropic's AI Coding Breakthrough
entry.summary: First impressions and in-depth review of Claude 4, highlighting its groundbreaking 72.7% SWE-bench Verified score, real-world coding capabilities, and what this means for the future of AI-assisted software development.
